speaker: Viral image
vclaim: It says a picture showing thousands of Donald Trump supporters outside Orlando's rally.
date: stated on June 19, 2019 in a Facebook post:
title: This photo shows the Toronto Raptors ceremony after the Raptors won, not the Trump Caucus.
text: Since the inauguration of President Donald Trump, the allegations about the size of his crowds have been scrutinized even by some of his supporters. Facebook users were skeptical after publishing a photo account showing a crowded city street. "This was all Trump's supporter (as is the case) outside of Arina last night in Orlando last night on the streets," reading the article of June 19. Tell me Trump's losing! I don't think so!" This article, in which more than 2,200 participants took part within a week, was referred to as part of Facebook efforts to combat false news and misinformation in the broadcast of the news. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) "I love this and I want to share it with the family, but I have to make sure it's accurate for time and space and not manipulate it to be believed by those I share," wrote one of the users. Is there more you can share about the picture to give her more cream? Thex!" On January 18, 2021, in an interview with the right national radio program, "China was behind intervention and effort to overthrow our government and elections, electoral fraud." By Daniel Funk • January 19, 2021, the poster answered: "I'm sorry, all I can say is that the photograph was taken in Orlando Florida the night the re-election campaign was launched. Arina only sits for 20 grand. They had 120,000 applications for tickets! These are Trump's supporters who couldn't get in!" The reader, they're not. We salute the suspicious commentator who questioned the authenticity of the picture. In fact, the shots of a drone were still taken in Toronto after Raptors won the National Basketball Championship on June 14th. The photographer Toby Go took the scene, which you can see here. ∙ (Almost twenty-two stops to see what's still on Facebook.) On June 26, Trump himself said that there were "tens of thousands of people" who could not enter into a re-election campaign at the Amway Center in Orlando. However, Orlando Sentinel reported that the arena, with a capacity of about 20,000, was "to a large extent full." "Whether the weather - hot earlier today, raining in the afternoon - or only people want invitations to attend the historic reminder event, it seems that the number of people was lower than planned," wrote the paper on June 18. The flood zone planned on the other side of the ring was almost empty when the gathering started inside the ring. We're assessing this Facebook mail pants on fire!
